item.title: Waste bins leaking on the floor, 1st August
item.description:
Happens all the time. People leave it on the floor because the cant be bothered to put it in the bin. It then leaks for foxes and flies and damages the ground. The clearance area to get to the bins is also blocked in by cars so its difficult for the binmen to get to. Need CCTV and fines issued.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Un-maintained sewage outlet, 1st August
item.description:
This tall pipe is, I believe, an outlet for the sewers below. It is in need of maintenance, a piece of iron fell from the top recently, and it’s not been painted in the 38 years I’ve lived here. Outside 104 Southover, opposite Woodridge School

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Southover, Woodside Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches from tree resting on garage roof. Damage in the future likely, 1st August
item.description:
The tree on the corner of Lake Avenue (beside 2 Lake Avenue) has become overgrown and is now encroaching on the property. There is no damage yet, however, the branches are thickening and resting on the garage roof. It is clear that if they are not pruned soon, they will cause damage. The location of the branches, their thickness and their weight means that my mother who is 80, is not physically capable of pruning these safely. I would appreciate if someone with equipment and expertise could provide some help and assistance in this matter. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lake Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate broken onpposite 28 -30 st Andrews way leading to North Cray Woods, 1st August
item.description:
Constantly having to listen to illegal motorbikes riding onto Foots Cray Meadows through the alleyway in St Andrews Road, the gate has been broken for quite some time letting bikes freely go through, this needs to be fixed as I feel this is a way that kids are getting onto and out of the meadows and are dangerous as they ride at speed, can something be done about fixing the gate as someone will get hurt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17,19, St. Andrew's Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gullies causing flooding, 1st August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Conington Road, London
